so let me start with the idea of running some experiments and this has been talked about a number of times today as

back to the traditional approach to building out wigs we would spend three months building a business case for a
very large scale implementation and then we would spend a period of time going through a procurement cycle installing
some equipment and then at some point potentially months hence or years hence we would start to deliver value what we
want to do in the data space is we want to collapse that right back such that we're getting data in real time and
we're running experiments we have hypotheses about data we have hypotheses about the way that we can optimize our
supply chain we have ideas that if we run some models we might be able to optimize a flight plan or we might be
optimal to optimize the amount of food that gets on on a plane there's such opportunities with data to run

so smart organizations are really good at running experiments and enabling a culture that enables you to prove out
value with with with data the beauty of that is once you've run that experiment and you've had some success and let me

prove value to the organization and that gives you the ability to get your organization on board and I have to say
I see a little bit of what I would call data analytics fatigue out there where
